intro: Hemitelia denticulata, commonly known as the serrated hemitelia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves with serrated edges. It produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Hemitelia denticulata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
